briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Trial of SLITone(TM) Birch in Subjects With Hayfever

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* A history of birch pollen allergy
* Positive skin prick test to birch
* Positive conjunctival test to birch
* Positive specific Immunoglobulin E (IgE) to birch

Exclusion Criteria:

* Forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1)\<70% of predicted value
* History of seasonal allergy interfering with study
* History of symptomatic perennial allergy
* History of emergency visit or admission for asthma in the previous 12 month

outcomeMeasures.title: Daily Rhinoconjunctivitis Symptom Score
outcomeMeasures.description: A total of 6 rhinoconjunctivitis symptoms are recorded (runny nose, blocked nose, sneezing, itchy nose, gritty feeling/red/itchy eyes, watery eyes). Each symptoms is scored on a scale from 0-3 (no symptoms-severe symptoms). I.e. the total daily score can be 0-18.

outcomeMeasures.title: Global Improvement of Rhinoconjunctivitis Symptoms Assessed by the Subjects
outcomeMeasures.description: The number of participants who reported improved overall symptoms compared to the previous birch pollen season (each patient was asked to compare his/her symptoms in the 2006 birch pollen season with the symptoms in the 2005 birch pollen season).

outcomeMeasures.title: Adverse Events
outcomeMeasures.description: An adverse event was defined as: Any untoward medical occurence in a patient or clinical trial subject administered a trial product and which does not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment (International Conference of Harmonisation (ICH) Harmonised Tripartite Guideline E2A, Step 5).

outcomeMeasures.title: Daily Rhinoconjunctivitis Rescue Medication Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Rescue medication (desloratadine tablets, budesonide nasal spray, prednisone tablets) used for treatment of rhinoconjunctivitis symptoms not controlled by the study medication, were recorded. The total daily score was 0-30 (No medication-Maximum use of medication).
